critique: This document establishes a commission to promote the observance of International Human Rights Year in the United States. It explicitly references the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, the United States Declaration of Independence, the Constitution and laws of the United States, and the Constitutions and laws of the several States of the United States. It also mentions civil and political liberties and the human rights of all without distinction of race, color, creed, sex, or national origin. The commission is composed of various government officials and members appointed by the President. The document does not directly address immigration, executive power, federalism, national security, economic regulation, or social inclusion beyond the general commitment to human rights. Therefore, the scores are assigned based on this interpretation.
